directions: Add a small bit of oil to a medium-sized pot set over medium heat. Add garlic and jalapeños; cook just until fragrant (about a minute). Add quinoa, broth, beans, tomatoes, corn, and salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and let simmer for 25 minutes, or until quinoa is cooked and liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat; stir in cilantro and lime juice. Spoon into bowls and serve with desired toppings.
Mash the avocado with a fork until smooth, stir in lime juice, garlic and salt and pepper.
ingredients: 1 cup uncooked quinoa, rinsed well and drained
1 can (1½ cups) black beans, rinsed and drained
¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro, optional
To serve: salsa, sour cream, shredded cheese, crushed tortilla chips, and guacamole
1 ripe avocado, peel and pit removed
title: Mexican Quinoa with Lazy Guacamole
